channel.title: Help ME!
channel.description: Hey guys erm how do you add objects ??? I'm using a blank source ..

item.title: Help ME!
item.dc:creator: @magnifier magnifier
item.description:
@magnifier wrote:

I done already thanks I know this isnt a spoonfeeding community Zzzz I’ve been exploring mopar for a few months already .[quote=“rova1, post:8, topic:375249”]^My link provided a tutorial stating EXACTLY what you just said, if I was able to find it, so is he.

Last time I checked this wasn’t a ‘spoon-feeding’ community… (that’s what my sig describes)[/quote]

item.title: Help ME!
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“whattehp406, post:6, topic:375249”][quote author=magnifier link=topic=471204.msg3446294#msg3446294 date=1293463596]

[quote author=rova1 link=topic=471204.msg3446293#msg3446293 date=1293463586]

http://tinyurl.com/29xwxby

lol @ you trying to hide where your link goes…

OP: this should be a whole lot more useful: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,468506.msg3425111.html#msg3425111
[/quote] erm client class is wad ???
[/quote]lawl client.java is the client class open it with notepad[/quote]

Cant you people tell this guy wants spoonfeeding? Hes not going to get anything your saying
Just search for the public void “NewObjects()” and keep searching until your are faced with a huge method with tons codes similar to this:

makeGlobalObject(3153, 4851, 14100, 0, 10);

they all look like that? amirite?
so just copy that, and paste it on another line in that public void, and change it like this:
makeGlobalObject(XCOORD, YCOORD, OBJECTID, ROTATION, 10);//Ammo Crate

Read full topic
